TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit AddressingVersion extends System.Object

Docs.summary: The WS-Addressing version associated with a SOAP message or understood by an endpoint.

remarks.format:
## Remarks There are currently two version of WS-Addressing: WS-Addressing August 2004 and WS-Addressing 1.0. These versions can be retrieved using the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.AddressingVersion.WSAddressingAugust2004%2A> and <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.AddressingVersion.WSAddressing10%2A> properties, respectively. There is also an addressing version available that is not associated with WS-Addressing, which is retrieved using the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.AddressingVersion.None%2A> property. This value indicates that no version of WS-Addressing is used. This is primarily for transports that do not pass SOAP envelopes on the wire and therefore have no use for WS-Addressing.
The addressing version is part of the message version: specifically <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.AddressingVersion> provides the return type for the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.MessageVersion.Addressing%2A> property. The <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.MessageVersion> also contains the SOAP envelope version in addition to the addressing version information. The <xref:System.ServiceModel.EnvelopeVersion> provides the return type for the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.MessageVersion.Envelope%2A> property.

Docs.summary: Gets the addressing version that is not associated with WS-Addressing version.
Docs.value: The that is not associated WS-Addressing version.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The addressing version is part of the message version: specifically <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.AddressingVersion> provides the return type for the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.MessageVersion.Addressing%2A> property. The <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.MessageVersion> also contains the SOAP envelope version in addition to the addressing version information. The <xref:System.ServiceModel.EnvelopeVersion> provides the return type for the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.MessageVersion.Envelope%2A> property.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance string ToString() cil managed

Docs.summary: Returns a string representation of the current addressing version.
Docs.returns: A string that represents the current addressing version.

Docs.summary: Gets an identifier for the address version associated with WS-Addressing 1.0.
Docs.value: A singleton instance that identifies the that is associated with WS-Addressing 1.0.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The addressing version is part of the message version: specifically <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.AddressingVersion> provides the return type for the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.MessageVersion.Addressing%2A> property. The <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.MessageVersion> also contains the SOAP envelope version in addition to the addressing version information. The <xref:System.ServiceModel.EnvelopeVersion> provides the return type for the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.MessageVersion.Envelope%2A> property.

Docs.summary: Gets the version of WS-Addressing that is associated with WS-Addressing August 2004.
Docs.value: A singleton instance that identifies the that is associated with WS-Addressing August 2004.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The addressing version is part of the message version: specifically <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.AddressingVersion> provides the return type for the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.MessageVersion.Addressing%2A> property. The <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.MessageVersion> also contains the SOAP envelope version in addition to the addressing version information. The <xref:System.ServiceModel.EnvelopeVersion> provides the return type for the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.MessageVersion.Envelope%2A> property.
